body_html:
Hi, I converted the numpy version of ms-ssim in tensorflow-contrib to a TensorFlow version. I could add it to tensorflow and maintain it, but I've never contributed to tensorflow before. I've looked at the contributing.md, so the procedure is clear to me. I just don't know in which file to put it. I see there are losses in Tensorflow contrib, but it seems depreciated. Should I still put it in there? Thanks for the help.

Here is the reference implementation that I used, it seems based on the matlab reference implementation of the author of the MS-SSIM.

https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/compression/image_encoder/msssim.py

Please tell me if you're willing to have the MS-SSIM build-in in tensorflow, and if yes, in which file I should put it. I'll do a proper PR then.

body:
Hi, I converted the numpy version of ms-ssim in tensorflow-contrib to a TensorFlow version. I could add it to tensorflow and maintain it, but I've never contributed to tensorflow before. I've looked at the contributing.md, so the procedure is clear to me. I just don't know in which file to put it. I see there are losses in Tensorflow contrib, but it seems depreciated. Should I still put it in there? Thanks for the help.

Here is the reference implementation that I used, it seems based on the matlab reference implementation of the author of the MS-SSIM.

https://github.com/tensorflow/models/blob/master/research/compression/image_encoder/msssim.py

Please tell me if you're willing to have the MS-SSIM build-in in tensorflow, and if yes, in which file I should put it. I'll do a proper PR then.
